title: INTER ALIA
html:
INTER ALIA

(From The [London] Times, March 13, 2002):

Sir, It is good to be reminded of the ellipsis (letter, March 12; see also letters, March 6, 8 and 9). “He done good” is not ungrammatical after all. It is an ellipsis, standing for “He (has) done (that which is) good”.

Master the ellipsis, and you will never speak ungrammatical.

Yours sincerely, MILLETT,

House of Lords. March 12.
